_header: In the old days of King Arthur
Title(s): Wife of Bath’s Tale; Canterbury Tales
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Wife of Bath’s Tale of the Canterbury Tales — 408 lines in couplets, with some versions including additional lines.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
IN the olde dayes of kyng Arthourof the which bretons speken grete
                    honour…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…and olde & angry nygardis of dispencegod sende hem sone a
                    verry pestilence
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And folwyng bigynneth hir tale (f. 94v); the wiff of
                    Bathe (RT); Here endith the wiff of Bathe hir tale… (f. 100)

BodBar20.First Lines:
In old dayes of Kyng ArthourOf wiche þat britons spake grete
                    honour…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…And old and angry nygardes of dispenceGod send hem sone
                    verray pestilence
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
Of bathe (RT); Here endithe Wif of Bathe… (f.
                    120v)

Bod414.First Lines:
[I]N olde dayes of Kyng ArthoureOf whom that Britons speke gret
                    honoure…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…And olde and angry negardis of her spenceGod send hem sone a
                    veraye pestilence
Bod414.Attributed Title:
The
                    w
                    wife of Bathis tale (f. 64)

Bod686.First Lines:
In the olde dayes of Kyng arthoureOf which þat Britons speke
                    grete honoure…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…And olde and angry nygardys of dispenceGod sende hem sone
                    verray pestellence
Bod686.Attributed Title:

                    (RT); Here endeth the Wyfes tale of Bathe (f. 85v)

BodHatDon1.First Lines:

                    honour…
BodHatDon1.Last Lines:

                    verry pestilence
BodHatDon1.Attributed Title:

                    tale of þe wife of Bathe (RT); Here endeth the Wifes tale of Bathe…

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
…þer walkeþ now the limitour him selfIn vnder melis
                    and in mornyng…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…An olde and angrie nygard of dispenceGod sende him soon a
                    varrai pestilence
BodLauMis600.Note:
III.857-73 lost; 1031-2 reversed. Fol. 88 is a seventeenth-century
                    replacement leaf.

BodLauMis739.First Lines:

                    honoure…
BodLauMis739.Last Lines:
…And olde and angry nygardes of expenseGod send hem sone
                    verrey pestilence

BodRawPoe141.First Lines:

BodRawPoe141.Last Lines:

                    very pestylence
BodRawPoe141.Attributed Title:

                    (RT)

CULIi326.First Lines:
In olde dayes of Kyng ArthoureOf which that bretonis speke the
                    honour…
CULIi326.Last Lines:
…And olde and angre nygardes of dispenceGod sende hym full
                    soone a verrey pestilence
CULIi326.Note:
III.945, 1234-5 omitted; 1031-2, 1179-80 reversed; 1144 blank; spurious
                    lines follow 1248.
CULIi326.Attributed Title:
…And here begynneth hir Tale (f. 119); Wyff of Bathe (RT); Here
                    endeth the Wyff of Bathes tale… (f. 124)

CamFitzMc181.First Lines:
[I]N the olde dayes of kyng ArthurOf which Bretons speken gret
                    honour…

                    gouerned by here wuyes…

TokyoTak22.First Lines:
IN olde dayes of kyng artureof whiche þat bretons speken gret
                    honour…
TokyoTak22.Last Lines:
…and olde and angry nygardys of dispencegod sende hem som
                    verry pestilence silence

                    honour…

…And olde and angri nigardes of dispenceGod send hem sone
                    verri pestilence
TokyoTak24.Attributed Title:

                        vxoris de Bathe… (f. 85v)
